WRITING.TITLE: I need help. I want to help the "future me", but i was screwed by the "past me".
WRITING.TEXT:
So there is a "past me", a "current me", and a "future me" in a never ending battle. The "current me" always hates the "past me" because the "past me", when in the "current me" state, did not care about the "future me" and therefore did w.e. he wanted and let the "future me" deal with it. So now I'm currently me and I got screwed yet again by "past me". I will inevitably become "past me" myself and there in lies my dilemma.
I want to end this vicious cycle, but since "past me" screwed me and I only have so much time to enjoy being the "current me", I may need to make some decisions that the "future me" won't like. But since by the time the "future me" becomes the "current me" I will already be the "past me", does it matter what the "future me" thinks? It'll be "future me's" problem and I would be ok.
Will this cycle ever end? Does anyone else have this issue?

My issue is there is a past me, a current me, and a future me in everlasting battle. The current me always hates the past me because the past me, when he was the current me, does not care about the future me. Therefore, the past me, in his current me form, does w.e. he wants and let's the future me deal with it once he becomes the past me. So now I'm current me and I got screwed yet again by past me. I will Inevitably become past me, therefore I will enjoy my time as current me and do w.e. I want because that is future me's problem.
It's a vicious cycle.
Do you know what I mean?

Trust is something not easily earned. Don't believe me? Then believe yourself. Don't believe yourself? Then believe me.

WRITING.TITLE: The blackout is ridiculous
WRITING.TEXT:
Seriously guys. How you do not see that this blackout can only negatively impact the game at worst, and not impact the game at best, is beyond me. We have already bought the game and they are already trying to fix it. If the community bands together to go long stretches without playing, then why would they keep putting resources into the game when they can just move on to the next project?
Look at the rate of improvements with the playerbase somewhat intact, then imagine the screeching halt that could come if the playerbase suddenly vanishes.
Seriously people. Grow up. You want to retaliate? Retaliate with your wallets. Don't buy steel. Don't buy season pass. But continue to play. If the playerbase remains the same but steel sales drop immensely then it will incline them to do better and increase those steel sales. But if not one is playing the game at all then why bother?
TL;DR don't be lazy.

WRITING.TITLE: Nooby looking for guidance/advice on my firs telescopes
WRITING.TEXT:
Hello all.
I've always had a fascination for space and have finally made the decision to buy a telescope. I have my eye on two at the moment and wanted to see if you all had any thoughts on answering the follow questions, of which I will preface with the follow:
1) My budget is up to $550 with wiggle room, but the lower I can get that without sacrificing much the better.
2) I will mostly view moon and planets since I will be viewing with lots of light pollution, but I have good spots I can drive too for deep sky sessions. So I'm looking for something reasonably easy to move and capable of both.
Right now the two I've found that I have my eye on are explore scientific ar102mm for $549 with a mount included.
The second is a cheaper one, Orion 9024, with a mount included for $280.
Now, I will mostly be looking at planets, but I want to be able to see deep sky objects as well since I will occasionally make the drive to do so. Will these scopes provide a clear imagine of planets and objects? I've seen some uploaded pictures of Jupiter for instance on some scopes and although I can tell it is Jupiter, it isn't as clear as I'd like.
Do you guys think either of these can get the job done? Or, do you know better scopes around the same price? I do not mind slightly breaking the budget if it's really worth it.
Thank you all for your time reading and chiming in.
TL;DR Orion 9024 , explore scientific ar102mm, or your recommendation? Budget $550 with wiggle room. looking for both deep sky and planetary viewing, mostly planetary. Please read post

WRITING.TITLE: Counter Daily Reminder: Game isnt dying and its an incredible game
WRITING.TEXT:
I truly don't understand why there's so much hate for this game on Reddit. If I never got on Reddit I wouldn't even think anyone hated this game lol I have 4 friends who play with me and none of them use Reddit. All 5 of us have loved the game from hour 1 to now our each 100+ hours of game time. We get disconnects here and there sure, but not so often as to take away from the experience.
Yes coming up at first we would get beat on by some 108s, but once we figured out how revenged worked it was manageable and something we wanted to strive for. Seeing these geared out beasts dominating the battle field just gave us an urge to play more and attain that level of power. And beating a 108 in a 1v1 encounter in a close Dominion match accounts for many of my early on, epic feeling, moments.
All in all the game is great. There's a learning curve sure, but it's still a unique experience that can't be experienced in any other game at the moment. My friends and I LOVE this game.
Maybe we're lucky since we have great internet so never really DC when we play. Maybe we didnt look at 108s as a nuisance and more as a goal to achieve. Watching them destroy 2 or 3 of us did nothing but teach us not to go in guns blazing all the time.
TL;DR Game is amazing for my friends and I and not sure why it gets so much hate. It's really a great experience.

And then followed it up with:
Roman Campos Oriola:I personally think Revenge is completely mandatory in a group fight scenario. The issue you're facing in group fight scenarios is that you're getting overwhelmed and constantly interrupted. So you need a tool to be able to make the difference.
The goal behind the Revenge is if you're able to survive a little bit, then you will have a tool that will allow you to make a difference - but only for a short period of time. You need to time well your activation, and have a clear strategy for how you're going to use it, because you get that chance and after it's over.
In a group fight scenario it works well, and today when we look at the data about kill/death ratio in group situations, we are in a spot that I think is interesting. When you're against two players, one time out of three you can survive. When you're against three players, it's one out of five on average.
The tough part has always been to find the balance where when you're ganking someone, you need to feel that you're going to kill him, and it's not bullshit because you're actually two on one, or three on one. And when you're that person, you should always see the light at the end of the tunnel, like, yeah, maybe I can take one or two with me. Maybe sometimes - rarely - I can actually win. I think Revenge serves that purpose well.
In Duel it's an interesting debate that we had internally. Personally, I like Revenge in Duel. Why? Because Revenge is a little bit like the Ultra in Street Fighter. It's an event that happens at some point toward the end of the fight. It does not happen every time. But it completely changes the mind games at that moment.

WRITING.TITLE: People need to realize gear stats aren't bad and either is Dominion
WRITING.TEXT:
I just want to start by saying that I see Dominion and gear stats get a lot of hate on this sub. Most of the complaints are about gear stats and balance and competitive play and feats and the list goes on.
Now, I understand that most people on this sub play a lot and therefore are pretty good at the game. I also understand that by being good at the game you get annoyed when someone not as good as you are, but with far better gear, beats you solely because of their gear.
However, I draw the line when people CLAIM that gear stats are ruining the game. Let's take Overwatch as an example. Recently it underwent many changes that affected only the top their of players and did not affect anyone in bronze, gold, or platinum. Do you know how much of the player base falls under diamond??? 85%. That means that most players are casual and not highly skilled.
I feel the same goes for many games, and for honor is no exception. I'm not the best player around and I gladly accept that. My schedule and life only affords me an hour or two of game time, about every other day, and that's fine. When I sit down to play do you think I want a super balanced always competitive fight where multiple enemies mean certain death and a 1v1 against a really good player means I lose always?
No, if you're good at the game and are trying a new character, and I'm using my main with 108 gear, I WANT to be able to hang with you and beat you even if it's ONLY because of my gear. If the only way I can get an insane quad kill is by dropping a catapult on your team or if you are guarded a ladder so we can't climb up and I take you out with a heat seaking guided arrow, so be it.
Gear stats are fine, they make the game fun and interesting for players of all skill levels, especially for casuals who make up most of the player base. Denying these players the ability to feel bad ass, win, and win consistently enough to warrant continued play means they will move on to the next fun to play game, leaving your beloved competitive game a Barron wasteland of inevitable death.
TL;DR gear stats are fine because they help casuals who make up most of the player base. Don't claim GS ruins the game when in fact it makes it enjoyable for all.

You not living will NEVER be better for anyone. Never think or say that. We all go through tough times because we all go through good times. If you have never experienced happiness then you wouldn't know you were sad because you'd have nothing to compare it too. And without a bit if sadness we wouldn't appreciate the good.
I started college when I was 18, by 21 I dropped out. Years passed where I thought I was a failure while watching friends go on to bigger and better things. I eventually went back and graduated, 6 years later at the age of 27 with a degree most people I knew had by the time they were 22.
But I did it, and I'm happy now. It wasn't in my area of original focus, I changed majors many times, but found something I truly enjoy. It took me years to really self reflect and mature as an individual before I was able to tackle school again. In that meantime I worked dead end jobs and had no degree. But now things have changed.
You do not know where you will be in 1, 2, 5, 6 years. Life always has ups and downs. You will always have downs. But you will also have ups. Taking your life is never the answer. Just consider what you are facing and compare it to someone else. Look at Stephen Hawkings condition and he continues carrying on. Your situation can always be much worse and there are always people in much worse situations maintaining a positive mindset.
Just being alive and being able to see a sunny day or rainy night, feel the wind, eat, sleep, laugh, think, be bored. Anything is better than nothing. And becoming nothing by taking your life will only being pain and suffering to those you love.
Keep on pushing forward. Life might seem bad now but it won't always be. Take it from someone who earned a 4 year degree in 10 years. I can relate. The feeling if disappointing people sucks. But that's that all there is to life. Learn to ignore it and move at your OWN pace. Your pace may be similar to mine which is a bit slower than average, but that isn't bad, just different.

I'm a conqueror here and PK never really give me a tough time. Being slow you need to be the one who plays on reaction. I camp side guards at mid range to bait the over head lunge, block, GB side heavy and try for a shield bash to test their skill and see if they dodge or just get pummeled. Smarter PKs won't go for that but I throw it out there. When I'm rushed I just pick a side and block it. It becomes a guessing game with how fast her LA are so I just pick a side and hope it's the first, second, or third strike they throw, at which point you can parry, GB and repeat. I like to charge my heavy periodically at a distance just to keep the at bay and then dash to a side to cancel out of it. Believe it or not going into your infinite to cover distance and throwing out a heavy when somewhat in range lands occasionally and can catch people of guard. I use this to start funneling them in the direction I want, bottom line you want to force her against a wall so that your shield bash heavy combo because inescapable.

I prefer minimum duration because I rather go into revenge more often rather than stay in each interval of revenge longer. The best part of gaining revenge is making the opponents timid since they can get knocked down. That alone gives you momentum. And once you use revenge and fight them off you can more quickly get out of that state and threaten with another revenge immediately after your quick super Saiyan outburst.
Just my opinion though and how I like to play.
I'm a conqueror if that helps.

Rep 3 conqueror with GS of 108 and I will say gear DOES matter in 4v4. Obviously it is dependent on player skill because I have beaten people with 40+ GS in a 1v1 with gear stats enabled and my character having a GS of 0, but getting to the higher GS is a whole other ball game. In a 4v4, if you or two, or three even of your teammates surround my conq I can easily handle and kill all of you because of how quickly I gain revenge, how hard it is to kill me, and how much damage I do. Even if you find me alone and we 1v1 I can still get revenge if I block a couple of your hits.
But don't let this turn you off to the game. Not many people you run into are at a 108 GS and therefore not everyone exploits revenge builds so you will be fine 95% of the time in 4v4. Duels, for example, do not use gear stats and unless you have best of the best gear they will not affect the outcome aslong as you are a more skilled player.

This pretty much right here. You don't need to react to her lights honestly lol just pick a side. PK always alternate directions. Pick a side, take a stab or two, but you'll catch one and then you can GB and go off on them. I beat PK all the time as conq it's really not that hard.
Some say his taunt absorbs the soul of his fallen opponent.

Just be defensive and reactive. His shield bash heavy combo is nice for 50/50 since you can follow the initial heavy with a shield bash or another heavy, if they dodge expecting the bash you get a hit in, if they expect a hit and block and it's another bash, by that point they're stamina drained. Especially if you GB off a parry into a shield bash you can quickly exhaust opponents. I like to attack their stamina rather than their health at first and I really open up on them once they're exhausted. Works for me maybe not for everyone? And also something to use sparingly is using full block as a feint since you can't feint. Wastes a ton of stamina though so be careful.
He has very safe parry as well. Just hold your heavy on parry. If they feinted all you did was charge a heavy. If they go for an attack at that point and you release the charged heavy with parry timing your superior block will still block the attack and you'll get in a guaranteed charged heavy. If they didn't feint initially then you parry them and go back to the original strategy.
Good luck!

Basically when they go for a heavy and you parry it that automatically drains some of their stamina, if you follow it up with the guaranteed GB and then do a shield bash rather than a light or heavy, watch how much stamina you drain off of them. It highly limits their offense. I follow it up with the side heavy and try to go for another shield bash and start that shield bash 50/50 game to get them in exhaust range. If they dodge you still put them on the defensive at that point and you should be able to react accordingly depending on your opponent.
Edit: by shield bash I mean forward dash into shield bash immediately after a GB.
Go for it. You won't be disappointed.

But his turtle abilities are incredible and he can really punish offensive players while have a decent enough offense to break players down. Shield bash stamina drain is serious with him and the punishment he gives off of parry are no joke. If that doesn't warrant him in top tier idk what would other than him just obliterating everyone.

WRITING.TITLE: Why isn't conqueror respected more?
WRITING.TEXT:
Just wanted to see what I'm not seeing here. I'm a rep 3 conqueror and have been reading through what people think of all the classes and I always see conqueror a lot lower on most people's lists than I would expect. What am I not seeing here?
In my opinion conqueror is an extremely strong class even in duels. The fact your blocks stop chains and, on parry, if you follow up with a shield bash after a GB, you essentially drain all of your opponents stamina. By applying even light pressure at that point you can pretty consistently exhaust them and drop them to the ground to open up for big damage.
Now of course you need to take a defensive style to achieve this, but I mean you're a guy with a shield, defense is implied. Some people may choose to force you to make the first move and avoid your defense all together until you give them an opening, which is fine by me and preferred honestly. If you use your infinites to get in close, safely, and use full guard to occasionally "feint" and mix in dashes into shield bashes you can pretty much force your opponent to retaliate with offense or get bullied around. Once that happens well, I just said it above.
So of course I lose. I don't always win. But I win enough against all classes that I don't believe a conqueror to be a poor man's warlord, but rather a top tier class.
What do you guys think? Agree? Disagree?
TL;DR: Conqueror is stronger than people say he is. RAW RAW RAW RAW RAW RAW
Bring me to the top! RAW RAW RAW RAW RAW RAW RAW RAW RAW RAW RAW RAW RAW RAW RAW

WRITING.TITLE: To the people complaining about Guard Break changes
WRITING.TEXT:
Just wanted to say you need to be realistic. You think just because guard breaks work a certain way in competitive play that it shouldn't be changed to accommodate players at lower tiers, which is 90% or more of the total player base?
Unless you want the game's community to die and development to cease completely because of the lack of profit then you should make the game as suitable to new and casual players as possible without completely destroying the depth of the system for the higher level players, which is what I think is happening here with the guard break changes.
A higher level player will still destroy a new player, but atleast the new player won't get GB to death and have a frustrating experience like has been the case with that whole system.
I personally do not mind if a casual player can CGB me, either way I GB when I get a free one and I'm still going to out play then and win regardless.

This is something I've noticed as well. If you can CGB an orochi it's pretty much over. Storm rush is easily blocked. If they go for their side dash attacks you know exactly where to block. If they get in close just camp high guard since they're only quick move is that double over head. Everything else can be reacted to other than that so just block how, CGB, and you won right then and there. Once I mastered the timing on CGB against orochi they have never ever beaten me again in a duel since other than a GB into a heavy for big damage they don't really have any other mix ups.

This doesn't make sense. Because as a conqueror I am nothing without a solid defense since all of my attacks are extremely slow and weak. If they nerfed my block they'd have to seriously buff my offense. But then why bother playing a shield class if I'm going to act as any other sword wielding DPS class? I pick the conqueror to play exactly that way, turtle behind a shield and methodically break down an offensive character with my shield and batter them with my slow flail.
Punishing blocking severely punishes us shielders. Unless these changes only affected blocking with a sword I feel it would render the risk reward of a conqueror, for example, not worth it therefore making him kind of unplayable. It's hard enough as it is reading feints and CGB until I find an opening with a conqueror as is without taking big damage on successful blocks. If 70, 50, or even 40% of damage went through it'll completely break the game once you start getting spammed into oblivion by assasins.

Yes I don't see the big deal either. I always stand away with high guard Incase they lunge. And if they get close I do exactly that. I hold block left and it'll happen, either first or second hit, GB them, shield bash to drain some stamina. And start pushing the pace. Repeating that pressure I either make them run or drain them of stamina and start doing hard damage. Conqueror main here.
Correct.
Shorter duration. Best part of revenge is the instant knockdown so you can two shot someone. Higher gain + shorter duration means more opportunities to knock people down.

I honestly don't see why. She needed the fix. I'm a PK main trust me I know. Hopefully next patch they can buff our zone attacks since they don't cover as much range as you'd expect. A full 360 coverage would be much needed.
